title: 3Deeplabcut calibration
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** Windows 10 Version 2.1.8.2 on Google Collab **Describe the problem** Hello, while trying to calibrate my cameras for 3D deeplabcut usage I always get the following message: Corners not found for the image xxx. Even after binarizing the image to enhance contrasts it was not able to find the corners (see image). ![camera1_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62014527/102777107-406a6c00-4390-11eb-9bce-99ec24ecc054.jpg). Any other deeplabcut usage is working perfectly. Please place code inside this:
Code output

import os os.environ["DLClight"]="True" import deeplabcut lel = '/content/drive/My Drive/3DLick-Edu-2020-10-19-3d/config.yaml' deeplabcut.calibrate_cameras(lel, cbrow =7,cbcol =9,calibrate=False,alpha=0.9) [Corners not found for the image camera1_1.jpg] **Config.yaml:** Project definitions (do not edit) Task: 3DLick scorer: Edu date: Oct19 Project path (change when moving around) project_path: /content/drive/My Drive/3DLick-Edu-2020-10-19-3d Plotting configuration skeleton: # Note that the pairs must be defined, as you want them linked! - - - - tongue - Lickport - - Nose skeleton_color: black pcutoff: 0.4 colormap: jet dotsize: 15 alphaValue: 0.8 markerType: '*' markerColor: r Number of cameras, camera names, path of the config files, shuffle index and trainingsetindex used to analyze videos: num_cameras: 2 camera_names: - camera1_ - camera2_ scorername_3d: DLC_3D # Enter the scorer name for the 3D output video_sets: bodyparts: start: stop: numframes2pick: alphavalue: TrainingFraction: iteration: resnet: snapshotindex: batch_size: cropping: x1: x2: y1: y2: corner2move2: move2corner: config_file_right_: C:\Users\deepl\RightTrackLicking-Edu-2020-10-05\config.yaml config_file_left_: C:\Users\deepl\LeftTrackLicking-Edu-2020-09-30\config.yaml shuffle_camera-1: 1 trainingsetindex_camera-1: 0 shuffle_camera-2: 1 trainingsetindex_camera-2: 0
